Directions: Listen to the audio clip “Address to the Nation about National Energy Policy, November 25, 1973,” read the passage “Radio Address about the National Energy Crisis, January 19, 1974,” and then answer each question.
Context: In 1973, some members of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) banned petroleum exports to the United States and introduced cuts in oil production. As the price of oil rose sharply in 1973, President Richard Nixon addressed the American people to explain the steps the people and the government would take to deal with the emerging energy crisis.
Listen to the following speech given by Richard Nixon on November 25, 1973.
